title: For Sale:  Get a grip, people!
postcontent:
So many of these ads are getting out of hand.  We either have people trying to sell a used gun for a new or higher price, or people wanting to buy a quality gun for significantly less than its fair market value. 

Sellers:  Your guns are not made of gold!  And don't forget that the pending gun legislation was shot down several weeks ago.  Stop trying to sell Glocks and such for outrageous prices!!  And just because you installed some custom parts on your budget 1911 does not make it worth any more than a new one at Academy Sports.  If you're researching completed Gunbroker auctions to see what a particular type of firearm is selling for, you cannot take into account inflated prices during the recent buying frenzy.  That frenzy is gone.  You missed the boat on the high dollars if you didn't sell your gun in January or February. 

Buyers:  Stop placing ads trying to buy a quality pistol for $150-200.  Go to your local pawn shop and buy a crap Hi-Point or something if that's all you want to spend.  Nobody is going to sell you a good S&W, Ruger, Sig, etc for that amount of money.

We need to meet in the middle and start selling and buying firearms for a current fair market value, not some unrealistic figure.  It's ok to negotiate, but when most people see a whacked-out price, they just keep browsing and think that the seller/buyer is unrealistic and would be a waste of time to deal with.
